channel.title: Q: Death is boring. What would you like to do/see when dead?
channel.description:
We looked at the issue of death in our game and we don't want it to be boring. Who wants to be left out if you died on round 2? No one! Let's fix that! What are your thoughts on:
* Appear in a grim graveyard at night to roam with your dead buddies! * Non-Game-Breaking "death abilities" * Appear as a ghost the following day and join the round the table - able to socialize with the other dead
What else would you like to add? Or, as an alternative to our ideas, what would you like to see _instead?_

item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
Limited death emotes to certain classes is very interesting because you actually WILL be a ghost while dead. However, you’ll only be able to free roam while dead or in your room at night if our stretch goal is met. Day roaming would not be possible in the core game. Perhaps a future experimental mode.

The Priest can resurrect but that’s pretty much it. The Psychic can speak with the dead and some abilities allow similar manipulation. There’s quite a lot of social manipulation that other games don’t have.

item.title: Q: Death is boring. What would you like to do/see when dead?
item.dc:creator: Polaris
item.description:
I’m a huge fan of dead life mechanics, so as long as there’s no chance of resurrection, I’d like to see:

  • Emotes like /rattlechains, /dance, /booo that only the few classes that can interact with the dead can see/hear.
  • I really like the “Death Roulette” suggestion, above.
  • Free roaming, everywhere, at all times: the castle, grounds, other rooms, etc. But if you leave the immediate area, you would miss the chat.

While I think it would be lots of fun for the dead players to be able to see all chat and/or eavesdrop, folks on voicechat can easily share information and give partner players a big advantage.

item.title: Q: Death is boring. What would you like to do/see when dead?
item.dc:creator: deadfrien
item.description:
Why not a death minigame called “Death Roulette”?

You can bet “Death Coins” or in-game currency on who will die, how soon they’ll die, and whether they’ll die by execution or at night. If you want even higher winnings, you could bet on who’ll they’ll die by (not by name, but by “Assassin” or “Cult”).

Of course, this could be shortened to individual nights, and just betting who’ll die and (maybe) which role they’re killed by.

The people with the highest “Death Coin” count can earn points towards a special skin or get in-game currency.

And maybe a fun little animation with a spinning light, and lights up the players that died that night, and with a blank space lit if no one dies.

Give the player the option to explore the whole castle during daytime. item.title: Q: Death is boring. What would you like to do/see when dead?
item.dc:creator: suddenlyANerd
item.description:
So would it only be playable at night? I suppose that, if that is the case, dead players would be able to focus on the chat during the day, but I think it could run the risk of not being all that fun unless the movement mechanics have some complexity to them (e.g. a button to sprint, slowly building up speed as you run etc.)

Regarding a Russian Roulette-style minigame, maybe a pass the bomb sort of thing? Lets say that someone in the dead chat can use a chat command to create a bomb on the “floor”. That bomb would have a random timer (random within reason, so there’s no chance of it having a 2 second timer or something ridiculous like that) hidden to players. A player would be able to pick up the bomb with another command and then pass it onto someone else if they wish, or just hold onto it. When the bomb explodes, whoever’s holding onto it and whoever’s not spent enough time holding onto it loses, and whoever’s spent the longest total time holding onto the bomb (without it exploding whilst they’re holding onto it) wins. I’d say either no prize for this or a small amount of in-game currency.

So, how would you address my concerns about the tag game, and/or what do you think of my suggestion?

item.title: Q: Death is boring. What would you like to do/see when dead?
item.dc:creator: SirMathias
item.description:
I would like to see some objective ghosts could have, either outside the human realm or still be able to affect the human realm; appearing as a ghost of your dead character and being able to say cryptic things to hint players along might be kind of cool.

For example, Shakespearean society (as far as I’m aware) understood the ghosts of certain people not to be those actual people, but rather another being with his own agenda. So when Banquo appeared to MacBeth, that wasn’t actually Banquo; that was a spirit trying to drive MacBeth crazy. The thought that higher beings are affecting human politics is an idea that is beyond creepy and awesome. I would love to be able to do that in this game.

Granted, that might cause serious problems with the balancing since it weakens the seriousness of killing someone. Plus players could collaborate beforehand that, if anyone dies, haunt a particular room and that would mean a specific code. Too obvious. And maybe that’s not the feeling you’re going for. But spooking people out ingame sounds like loads of fun.

If that’s not a good idea, the three previous options sound fun, but I would also like to be in an observer mode where I can see all chats plus all character’s movements.
